website_summaries.verdict: The Nvidia GeForce GTX 750 Ti graphics card sets a new record for low-power, high-efficiency performance.
pros: Single-slot design works well with small-form-factor PCs
cons: Flat performance compared with previous generation

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, and Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Got it because the one I selected would not ship to Japan. Needless to say, I was worried that this card wouldn't be able to keep up with today's games, being a little over a year old. Well, I couldn't be happier for the price. I've been playing GTA5 on high, and it handles it like a champ. Well over 60 fps. Does the job, looks good, and stays cool. Couldn't ask for much more out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Zakkery Sibley

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I can play any next gen game on high to very high settings and this thing never gets about 35 degrees celsius. As an added bonus, it makes no noise whatsoever and comes with useful software for overclocking and boosting fan speeds. Highly recommended for gamers--recently played Witcher 3 all the way through with most of the specs turned up and the framerate limiter turned off, and it never stuttered once (this is in conjunction with a 6-core AMD and 8 GB of RAM, FYI)
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel K. Stalling

customer_reviews.title: Poor support, errors.
customer_reviews.text: Card immediately started giving me errors after letting the PC go to sleep mode. I would come back to a screen saying there was a video memory management error. Messages left on their support board were not even answered. I also bought this product with a rebate card with a short expiration date. The first time I attempted to use it, the card was declined. Then it was expired. DO NOT EVER BUY A PRODUCT WITH A REBATE GIFT CARD! DEMAND A CHECK EVERY TIME. Worthless system with zero consumer protections.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for several months now without 1 issue to mention. I replaced a NVidia 4800GT in a 2010 Alien ware area 51 machine. The only installation issue I ran into was the power connected on the end of the 4800GT card and this has the power supply connection on the outside. I had to cut a small square hole in an interior cover so the cable would clear. I didn't mind doing this because the machine is getting a bit dated now but a lot of people may not think to check for this until they went to install it.
customer_reviews.author: Canable

customer_reviews.title: Great card.
customer_reviews.text: I love this card, BTW anyone ordering, either know that your PC has a 6 pin PCI E power supply cable, or get one with the card, or the adapter. I've lost the extra cables that came with my power supply, including that one. Took 3 more days to wait for the adapter. Now it's in and it's awesome though. I mainly play ESO, this card runs it nicely on medium to high. And I watch Hulu streaming to my TV at the same time via HDMI. I went back to Nvidia after trying AMD Radeon, and I'm very happy. That and this uses DDR 5 VS DDR3 that my Radeon card used. Much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy Odesskiy

customer_reviews.title: But he loved it and said it worked well
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my bf. His graphics card that came standard with his tower was crashing on him and running too high. He said this was exactly what he needed. He says it runs at 26 degrees vs 56 on his other component. He's able to play his games in full hd without any issues. Sorry I cant give a more technical review. But he loved it and said it worked well! Also the shipping was really fast and no issues with the box being damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: ASUS GeForce GTX 750TI Review
customer_reviews.text: ASUS GeForce GTX 750TI Review. I am very happy with this video card. It doesn't draw much power, and doesn't require any additional power cable hookup. It was an easy swap for my 9800, and greatly improved my gaming abilities. I've had it several months now, and no problems. If you have an older computer and want more graphics power, this is a great card to consider, lots of performance at a small price. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It lowered my cpu temp 10 degrees centigrade as the ...
customer_reviews.text: It lowered my cpu temp 10 degrees centigrade as the cpu no longer supplies graphics, I guess. I haven't tried any games on it yet, but am thinking about it. I thought it would work with the microsoft games, and the movies, but it doesn't seem to make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: F. Lum

customer_reviews.title: Held back a star that's support oriented, has nothing to do with the mechanics of the card. VERY good card.
customer_reviews.text: I use GTX 750 Ti's in my low end builds. Not everyone needs a gaming beast, but almost everyone would like to be able to play the basic stuff on medium or high settings. The only reason I usually don't use ASUS is their customer service is thought to be low end or non-existant (and rightfully so in my experience). They make quality stuff that's usually a joy to install, and I don't need help often building anything. This card is as good for it's genre as any other I use much more often. Cool, quiet and fast for it's purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Everything worked fine for 20 minutes or so
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid card and one of if not the only card that works with the IPISB-CH2 "Chicago" motherboard on my HP Pavilion h8-1160t. That motherboard is a "legacy" motherboard and does not support UEFI. Unfortunately the replacement card that I got was defective itself or my motherboard was having issues. Everything worked fine for 20 minutes or so, but then the video would start flashing. I'm banking on the issue being with the motherboard. The seller gave us a very prompt refund.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Sweeney Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great card for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This card was easy to install. It runs quiet and the visuals are far better than the 550Ti I was running previous. Playing WoW, I've gone from 50-70 FPS on low settings (with the 550Ti) to 60-80 FPS with this card. Playing the Division, I went from 10-15 FPS on the lowest settings to 40-60 FPS on mid range settings with this card. A major improvement, if I do say so. Especially while playing the Division, because now I can actually see detail in the clothing, facial features, etc. Would definitely recommend this as a mid-range replacement option, especially if you are currently running the 550Ti.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Shinault-Martin

customer_reviews.title: A Good Step Up for Gamers with older machine
customer_reviews.text: Great Upgrade for my HPE-140f. This card is a step up from the standard card that came with the computer when purchased from HP (geforce 230) No need for a larger power supply, runs 3 screens 1920x1080 in MAX graphics settings, WAR THUNDER runs great as do all my games. you will need an auxilary power cord that does not come with the card. COOL GPU Tweak/monitor software comes with
customer_reviews.author: Keith G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome card for the price
customer_reviews.text: This card has worked great for the few years that I used it. I am able to play Overwatch, Skyrim, Left for Dead 2 and other a few other games at high graphics settings with no problems. It is very quiet and doesn't get very hot. I would recommend this card for a budget build that you can eventually swap out when you can afford a better card later.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent graphics performance for the money. I used this to accelerate PhotoShop, as I am not a gamer. An increasing number of software applications are using GPU-based acceleration options so a high-end graphics card is getting increasingly mandatory. This is an inexpensive option that gives your applications a nice kick. And it will drive large monitors without blinking twice. The card is quiet and very well ventilated.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Gehlhaar

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Installation was straight forward
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Installation was straight forward. In my application this board co-exists with an ASUS GTX 650TI. To get a clean and stable configuration, the installation of the latest driver was needed. During the install it is important to select a "Clean" installation. The first attempt without a clean install resulted in performance issues and a hang when moving images between the 3 monitors in use. The clean install appears to have resolved this instability issue. I would recommend this card for video editing, photo editing, gaming and business needs.
customer_reviews.author: dwy603

customer_reviews.title: So I still have a good PC, and now a better card to use ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this card runs most games at maxed settings with no trouble, and I have an older PC. Newer games I imagine I'll have to lower the settings (I have a 2.2 Ghz, Quadcore Phenom CPU, 8 GB DDR2 Ram, and an Asus m3a-32 deluxe mb). So I still have a good PC, and now a better card to use with it. I'm very happy with the ease of install... I tried another ATI card before, and it was nothing but problems. I will never go with ATI again... Nvidia based Vid cards are the way to go. I'm very happy with this product so far, and the price didn't break my bank.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cormier

customer_reviews.title: Cheap for a reason
customer_reviews.text: Total crap. Had it for under 2 months and started making red sparkles on the screen. Another card didn't do this. Checked the card while running machine and the fans were not moving. No dust or dirt or hair anything they just stopped moving. You could see on the side the little power cord is plugged in and nothing looks ripped or anything, just an inferior product I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Justa Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good "value" graphics card
customer_reviews.text: This is a good "value" graphics card. Before I installed it, I was using the built-in graphics of my iCore 5 processor (Intel® HD Graphics 4600) and the GeForce GTX 750Ti was definitely a step up from the built-in graphics, so it was worth the money. Also, I like the quietness. It has dual fans, but they don't run at full speed unless needed, so my computer is still very quiet. I'm running three monitors in an extended desktop display, and the graphics card handles that with no problem. Overall, it's pretty good!
customer_reviews.author: Alan RC

customer_reviews.title: Nice card be careful when upgrading from a Radeon.
customer_reviews.text: Card works well. Only thing I would change is add a drive installer that removes the old graphics driver before adding the new one. I installed it on a system with a Radeon card without removing the old driver and put the machine into a boot loop. Fixed by booting into safe mode, remoing the Radeon driver, rebooting again, and then installing the GTX drivers. Kind of a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on my linux system (Ubuntu 16
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my linux system (Ubuntu 16.04) until the last software upgrade, and now it appears to be incompatible with my system. As long as this is connected to my motherboard, the computer never completes booting. As soon as I take it out... no problems booting up. But it's not the card's fault so I still give it 4 stars because while it worked it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Jack D. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Affordable gaming
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to play fallout 4. Have enough HDD, RAM and an A8-5600K but needed a good gpu. All of the sites that analyze game specs say to get some ridiculous gpu and that my cpu isn't powerful enough; stop right here if you're worried because it totally is. Pair this GPU with a mid-level CPU and you can explore the wasteland as well without having to buy a console and being stuck with well...a console. Haven't tested other games, don't care about them. Plays FO4 on high everything with max view distance on everything.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck. May be a little dated in 2016 though
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a little over a year ago at the time of this post and have to say that it was such a great deal back then, and still going strong. I was able to run Witcher 3 at about medium graphics (slight overclocking though) over all with great frame rate. I'm not a super hard core gamer as much these days, so having a product that was balanced both in price and power was a good deal. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jose F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - SUPER QUIET
customer_reviews.text: Nearly a seamless install - although initially would not boot up the machine. I researched other reviews and realized I hadn't flashed the BIOS on my board since I installed it 5 years ago - sure enough that was the issue. But the old card back in so I could take care of that, updated the BIOS, then re-installed this new card and voila - done. Super quiet, double the RAM of my last card. DOES require an additional power plug so make sure you've got an available one not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Belindaj

customer_reviews.title: Satisfying price/performance
customer_reviews.text: I'm really satisfied with the price/performance I got with this video card. My one annoyance is that I chose the 750Ti specifically to avoid having to upgrade my power supply, as it was on the short list of good performing chipsets that didn't require the extra PSU hookup. Unknown to me at the time of purchase, the ASUS implementation DOES require the extra PSU hookup, and if you don't have one, your computer will be a brick until you go change out your PSU.
customer_reviews.author: D. Michael McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Feeling pretty good about this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Feeling pretty good about this purchase. I replaced a GTX 550 TI that will go into another PC. I'm using Ubuntu 16.04 LTS with dual monitors. If you are an Ubuntu user and need a solid video card I highly recommend, all you need to do is download the correct driver from NVidia and install. I use my setup for day to day work so have no idea how this card performs with games. I do know that the other machine where I will install the 550 will be used for some games and it is much better than what is currently in that PC.
customer_reviews.author: amazombie

customer_reviews.title: This has my Need for Speed game running well!
customer_reviews.text: This has my Need for Speed game running well! Its onboard memory is ideal. Once I had it connected to the right connector so it had power I was golden. The card requires its own connection to the power supply and does not get its power from the slot as I thought initially. Too bad the customer service at the manufacturer was not adequate. That's all I'll say on the customer service I received when trying to determine whether I needed to change my PC power supply in order for this to work in the beginning
customer_reviews.author: Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Good solid card
customer_reviews.text: I recently built a new computer and needed a good solid quality graphics card for it. While I am not a gamer I sometimes use programs that are graphics intensive and this card has performed perfectly with them without breaking the bank. We use Amazon for most of our purchases and I update my reviews if anything changes with the products. I do this so other Amazon users can get a real feel for the life of the product. I am not associated with any company and all opinions are my very own.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: Oh lordy loo I love this card
customer_reviews.text: Oh lordy loo I love this card. This card has never had any issues has never overheated or anything. on my PC i5 4960k 8gb ram I could run Arma 3 on med settings 50-60fps. This card is amazing however it crashed when I tried to use shadow play which is kinda bad if you use shadow play but yeah. I would recommenced getting a GTX560TI with 2gb ram over this card because the 560 is a little bit more powerfull but this card is pretty good too.
customer_reviews.author: Borok Lau

customer_reviews.title: Working smoothly after a little fix
customer_reviews.text: Been using this gpu for only two days and I'm amazed. Bought it for the sole purpose of gaming, specifically GTA V, and had a little trouble at first. Just want to make a quick point that can hopefully help out some other gamers. MAKE SURE YOU INSTALL THE DRIVERS! Can't stress that enough. At first I was experiencing horrible lag and couldn't figure out the cause but the second I got the driver installed it worked like a dream. I would recommend using the GeForce Experience application as it not only installs your drivers and watches for updates, but it allows you to optimize the settings of all your games through the app with just one button.
customer_reviews.author: Jabe

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR PEOPLE ON A TIGHT BUDGET!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for people who are starting off their very own and first PC build. A very decent price for people who are on a tight budget. Works great for A LOT of games out there. This graphics card has 2 DVI, 1 VGA, & 1 HDMI outputs for those wondering. Overall i would totally recommend to anyone on a tight budget and/or for those who are starting off their very first PC build.
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Graphics Card.
customer_reviews.text: This video card is wonderful. It came safely packed and it works like a charm. I'm able to play all my games with high graphics settings. You can OC (overclock) the video and video ram processors as well as control the cooling fan speeds. Which, might I add, the cooling fans are very quiet. When I installed it into my motherboard it was a tight fit but then again my PC case is smaller compared to newer cases. If you're on a low budget but want something powerful, this the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Darbok

customer_reviews.title: Good video card
customer_reviews.text: No problems with Ubuntu Linux 14.04. Just make sure you install the correct driver as directed by the Nvidia website, don't use apt for it. Consistently got 150-200+ FPS in Team Fortress 2 and Portal 2 on Steam for Linux, with 12 GB RAM and FX-8320 CPU. Low power usage but this model DOES require a power plug from the computer PSU, it does not run on PCI slot power alone.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: but for what I do this is a great buy. I use it for protein folding simulations ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a gamer, but for what I do this is a great buy. I use it for protein folding simulations (see foldingathome.org). Previously I used an older Nvidia card, 460GTX I believe it was, but this one produces 2-3 times as much resulting computation and has also lowered the power consumption of the entire computer by approx. 80 watts. I call that a win-win.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Smith

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong. Upgraded to a 1050 and a 1060, and after a week downgraded back to this 750ti. Just seems to run better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Zachk

customer_reviews.title: forgot i bought this...
customer_reviews.text: like all computer products of this type, was outdated 5 months after i bought it. so i give it a "meh"
customer_reviews.author: el diablo con queso

customer_reviews.title: Pros: Dead quiet, the fans are not required ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Dead quiet, the fans are not required to spin when idle or when you are not gaming. When you are gaming you can barely hear it (Case: Corsair 250D). It doesn't require power connectors (PSU: Corsair RM 450W). Run older games 1080p max settings and more graphically demanding modern titles at 1080p low/medium. Cons: No SLI I think its ideal for an HTPC.
customer_reviews.author: SkyZero

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect video card
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect video card. work very well with media / photo / games . I bought this video card for option to connect 4 monitor without any additional cables splinter and other connectors. it performs excellently in particular working in Photoshop.
customer_reviews.author: thermex

customer_reviews.title: this is a great card.
customer_reviews.text: There is a whole lot of hoopla in the PC gaming community about spending a ton of $$$ on graphics cards and playing at ultra on 4k, but if you're looking for a ton of bang for your buck, and enjoying games more for the gameplay and the story than the graphics, this is a great card.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick L Naylon

customer_reviews.title: Great moderate gaming card for older pcs (3-5 years)
customer_reviews.text: 2nd one of these bought. Great moderate gaming card for older pcs (3-5 years). Helps with video taking some of the work off the cpu and mb. Most games will run fine with this card. I have had no problems with the pcs using these cards. Easy install, software works great.
customer_reviews.author: James Waterman II

customer_reviews.title: Great for an aging PC
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my father's aging PC along with an SSD, runs like new and is even more responsive than when he bought it. Can run light games (tested HP and Chamber of Secrets and RCT3).
customer_reviews.author: Adam Despen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Just amazing. Came in perfect condition, plug and play. I can play everything and anything at 60fps. It is so quiet I cannot tell it's on, very low power consumption for the output. It is quite big so make sure your mobo can fit it. Could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Like the Nvidia ASUS GeForce GTX 750Ti GDDR5 2GB Graphics Card
customer_reviews.text: This video card has accelerated my PC with real snappy graphics. Also it has fixed a problem with my Motherboard that would crash every so often as it had trouble working with multiple video cards. Now I can hook up several monitors without the crashing the PC, all to the same video card. I like the Nvidia ASUS GeForce GTX 750Ti GDDR5 2GB Graphics Card
customer_reviews.author: RedHeadEd

customer_reviews.title: Love this card!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this card! I never knew a computer could be so quiet! It makes me really want to get everything moved off the old computer so I can retire it and shut the noisy thing down. As for details, it runs Skyrim great on ultra graphics. I'm not a hard-core gamer, so I can't tell you how it runs the latest games.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Bill

customer_reviews.title: defective?
customer_reviews.text: I have no problem with ASUS as a whole. But this graphics card is defective. I've only had it for 5 months and it burnt out on me. With how much I spent and with how little money I have, I got this graphics card.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McDonald

customer_reviews.title: I think this is a good card if you don't really need a crazy powerful ...
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a good card if you don't really need a crazy powerful or expensive graphics card. My issue with it, was that it didn't have a display port. Display port is suggested to get the most our of a high performance monitor.
customer_reviews.author: DeNo Photo

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I am thoroughly impressed with this graphics card. I love the 4 monitor support. I use one as a TV. I have yet to find a game that will slow this card down! System: Win 7 x64 AMD Phenom II x4 3.20Ghz 8 GB Ram 250 GB SSD ASUS GeForce GTX 750Ti GDDR5 2GB Graphics
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B.

customer_reviews.title: Fast, cool and silent gf. card
customer_reviews.text: Very fast card for the price - installed in a PCI 1.0 slot with no problems in a 8 years old MSI mbo - v. good PCI 3 back compatibility to my old 1.0 slot. Be aware that is a long gf. card - ensure enough space in your case - about 10 inch will do. Congrats to ASUS/nVidia team for an impressive design on a cost effective but v. fast card.
customer_reviews.author: AdiT

customer_reviews.title: I hate hate hate the updates
customer_reviews.text: I hate hate hate the updates.. My pc was finally e before the updates... Now all my text looks like I'm drunk.. Called/live chatted with customer service and they straight up said... "well, that's weird.. I don't k or what to tell you... Let me call you right back... That was 6 months ago.. Still no call.. Pretty sure he stood me up.
customer_reviews.author: Smackdye

customer_reviews.title: Ballin' on a Budget
customer_reviews.text: Great card for the price. It has yet to have any major issues since I have put it in my machine. I mainly play WoW, LoL CS:GO, and DA:I on it and the only issue I can think of was with DA:I when it was first released. However, from what I found it was an issue happening to many players and I believe has since been hot fixed. Haven't had any issues with DA:I since the first couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great Low Cost Card
customer_reviews.text: Not top of the line in video cards but for me an affordable upgrade from what I had. The graphics are much better than the older GeForce card I had. Well worth it for an inexpensive upgrade. The previous GeForce was used to improve the integrated graphics on the MB. That was a step up and this card is a step above that.
customer_reviews.author: David_De

customer_reviews.title: Great value, EXCELLENT care in packaging
customer_reviews.text: Great value for this card, excellent performance in all games and graphic design programs. The packaging is actually done very well on this video card. They tightly secure the card at the bottom of the box to prevent being rattled around inside. Well done on the packaging, all computer components should be packaged with as much care.
customer_reviews.author: MikeN

customer_reviews.title: This is a great card for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great card for the money. Very overclockable. I was able to get solid 720p and lower 1080p performance out of this card. Again, for the price paid, this is a great value. As long as you have reasonable expectations for this card, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome graphics card
customer_reviews.text: Awesome graphics card. I love the quality of the card and the ability to overclock the card. I'm not play a huge pc gamer however with this card gaming has been awesome. Installation was a breeze and recognized by the system with no issues. I'm currently using Asus X99-E WS Motherboard which works flawless with this card.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Compare to MSI Geoforce GTX 750 before buying
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, but does not work well with older computers, and when I say old I mean 4 years old not 10 years old. Maybe I just got a dud but I had to return it after calling tech support. I ultimately bought the MSI Geoforce GTX 750n and it works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Christophe Colebrook

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget graphics card for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for my first gaming build, performance is great, absolutely silent and stable on a asus G41 chipset/mobo running a core duo e7500, I can play smooth at native resolution 1680x1050 and everything maxed out like crysis, hitman absolution, mirror's edge, etc. With 25~fps being the lowest. The difference is huge if it's your first GPU and build. I recommend this as the best budget power-efficient graphics card that ever exist. I LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bronson

customer_reviews.title: Great video card for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great video card for the money. Glad I purchased this one with the external power connection because it takes a load off my mother board. My friend bought the EVGA version that powered off the motherboard and had problems with freezing and rebooting. He purchased this one and hasn't had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: super mutants, and other assorted weirdos with no problem
customer_reviews.text: I was noticing some lagginess with my old graphics card on Fallout 4. This little buddy perked things right up and has me rocking out and shooting deathclaws, super mutants, and other assorted weirdos with no problem. Things are so much better now!
customer_reviews.author: H. Wellborn

customer_reviews.title: what a great view
customer_reviews.text: This Asus graphics card with purchase as a gift or my son in law who is upgrading his computer. He absolutely loves this graphics card. He does a lot of online gaming and this graphics card serves the purpose very well. It arrived promptly and nicely secured. Thanks to the seller and Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Riddle

customer_reviews.title: I replaced my old GTX545 with this card and it's ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old GTX545 with this card and it's much nicer gameplay and smoother controls. I have an Alienware x51 and this was rather hard to get installed because the power on the card is located in a very inconvenient spot and doesn't quite fit by about 1mm, you really have to jam it in there. I got it to work however so I'd image you would be able to do the same
customer_reviews.author: JayPro

customer_reviews.title: Defective item, but return was easy.
customer_reviews.text: I tried installing on two different computers with two different versions of Windows. Would stop mid-install and start a reboot loop. Used good uninstall programs and still same problem. Amazon wouldn't replace it but did give me a refund. Got a different model Nvidia card and it installed and worked perfectly the first time!
customer_reviews.author: Salli

customer_reviews.title: Quiet power at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a specs hound but I did a little research and concluded that this was going to provide a ton of power at the right price for me. I do occasional video editing and gaming as a hobby only. This board installed easily and is whisper quiet compared to the jet engine I had before. I have used several Asus products before and don't worry about choosing them.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Byers

customer_reviews.title: pretty much performs as I'd expect
customer_reviews.text: pretty much performs as I'd expect, this might be cheap or "low end" to some but I almost never spend more than this on a graphics card. its definitely good enough for me
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Good card
customer_reviews.text: Update. I gave this a bad review that said it quit after 2-3 weeks. What happened was I built up the unit ans sent it to a branch office. They said it quit. When I got there a couple weeks later, I discovered they had hooked it up wrong. I plugged it in correctly and it works just fine. You will be happy with this card.
customer_reviews.author: rpj_eng

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Replacement, quiet, and so far, glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: Easily installed in my Dell XPS 8300. Runs quietly and graphics are great! I am not a gamer but bought this based on reviews and ratings AND that it would work on my system. I like that it has 2 fans for that extra cooling and likely length of life. Had trouble getting my rebate approved at first, but other than that, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Randall W. Rasner

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for the product, but worked great
customer_reviews.text: Worked when I needed it to. It was unfortunately a bad time of the year to buy graphics cards. It was defiantly over priced, but nothing else was available.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Great Card!
customer_reviews.text: Price per performance, this little thing rocks hard. For someone who only plays games moderately, this thing is perfect. I hardly play "graphically extensive" "next-gen" games, but instead stick to some classics. The most graphically intense game I own is Mirror's Edge, and the 750Ti performs flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Its A  BUY
customer_reviews.text: very easy to install. isolate power (unplug) remove case side panel with screwdriver, remove existing card with fingers (unplug) insert new card plug in, install case side panel power on have internet on and it does the rest I EVEN HAD EXISTING ATI drivers in NO problem new card didn't care OUTSTANDING Very cheap Running Fallout 4 on MED setting ^^
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Improved Windows Performance
customer_reviews.text: I researched numerous graphics cards, seeking improved performance and a higher "Windows Experience Rating". This card does a great job. I am not a gamer but do some video editing - but mostly just MS Office, QuickBooks, etc.I just like having fast computers.
customer_reviews.author: Bill75080

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Money Saver
customer_reviews.text: The GTX 750 Ti is a pretty amazing graphics card for the small price I bought it at. For my rig, it's able to withstand Overwatch on Ultra settings, and Killing Floor 2 on Ultra settings aswell. The installation is smooth and the size of the graphics card makes it easier. I've not played many games with GPU installed, but I've run them through CaniRunIt and the results show up mostly positive. Of course this product has a downside, the fact of the matter is that it has aged a few years, and it will struggle to run current games like Fallout 4 or Witcher 3. Other than that it's a great cost-efficient GPU.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Works like a charm! Only thing is to make sure you measure your chassis for your computer first- had to work some things around for my Studio XPS 9000 to get it to fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: FadeThen

customer_reviews.title: best pc components from asus
customer_reviews.text: asus is asus... best pc components from asus. buy with confident asus products, they are great and super . i am surprised how fast this card is. 5+++
customer_reviews.author: koba tsetskhladze

customer_reviews.title: No problems and it looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Great graphics card! I only wish it had 2 HDMI ports instead of one but so far there have been no problems. All of my games look great and I definitely recommend this card for a first time PC builder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was really impressed! Most cards require two power ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed! Most cards require two power cables to operate in older PC's (and mine isn't that old). This card requires only one, which I had. I've never played games at full LCD resolution before, and this just works! dead-silent too. Works perfectly on Linux provided you get the latest driver from Nvidia.
customer_reviews.author: edfardos

customer_reviews.title: Love this card
customer_reviews.text: Love this card! Running dual monitors now on it and tempted to add a third. Performs better than anything I have ever owned. Then again I never had spent more than $40 on a vid card until now.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: This graphic card rocks
customer_reviews.text: I am not a wildly smart computer person, but I know what happened after my nephew installed this for me. My WOW Game went through the roof. Framerate went from 9 to 59 and sometimes 79. I kick butt - Very happy violent old broad here. Very wonderful deal on a graphics card and very happy Wow player.
customer_reviews.author: Bonitamuerte

customer_reviews.title: ... and shadows are nearly unbelievable World of Warcraft is like a new world of graphics
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my 440 Femi card with this and wow shading and shadows are nearly unbelievable World of Warcraft is like a new world of graphics. This card is awesome I have bought 3 now 1 for me and the others for friends and we are all very happy and blown away with the graphics this card displays and we have it running on everything from a 40 1080p tv to a 24 inch lcd if you’re looking for some to play your game on in ultra-mode this card rocks it.
customer_reviews.author: viper83065

customer_reviews.title: All works well
customer_reviews.text: I have no pro blems with it, it works what can I say. Seems to be a good bu ild and I don't see it breaking down on me for quite some time
customer_reviews.author: Michael Vogler

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced gaming video. 60+fps at High in top games
customer_reviews.text: Great affordable gaming card. Bought it for my son's gaming desktop machine. He is getting 60-80 frame/second on high resolution on all the leading games he is playing. And the price is very affordable compared to the truly high-end cards. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: 1GoodDog

customer_reviews.title: It's a good card, but do not buy it if your ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good card, but do not buy it if your overclocking. The lack of external power makes you hit a lot of walls when trying to overclock.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Great for Older Games
customer_reviews.text: Great little card. Runs Wow on high settings-HOWEVER- if you are looking to play something more graphics hungry like Overwatch I would not recommend it. Even tweaking my system it still delivered unplayable frame rates. For a game like that I would suggest the GTX 1050 which is only about $10 more
customer_reviews.author: R. Smeltzer

customer_reviews.title: ... issues with this card and for the money its amazing. Playing Shadow of Morridor
customer_reviews.text: No issues with this card and for the money its amazing. Playing Shadow of Morridor, GTA5, Minecraft with high settings and they look perfect. I always buy the best video card around the hundred dollar range and this is the fastest one you can get right now.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Painless upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: System needed an upgrade to process CG files (Blender) faster. This card installed onto my Debian machine with out any issues and has reduced the rendering times on my test file from 45-46 seconds a frame to under 10 seconds a frame. I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: kelli a hocutt

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Me
customer_reviews.text: Me: How is the card? Any issues? Friend: Works. No issues. Good quality. Me: ... Friend: *shrug* Me: *rolls eyes* You are as talkative as my Husband.
customer_reviews.author: MamaTick

customer_reviews.title: Green lines and dots, when it actually starts
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in September and seemed to work fine but then it started to cause boot issues and when my PC did boot, there were green lines and dots all across the screen. I switched to onboard video and everything worked fine, so I know it was the video card. I recently upgrade my MB, CPU, and RAM and decided to try the videocard again, since it was past return window anyways. Same problem. Not sure what to do about this busted card, but I've always like ASUS and wish I could get this thing to work properly. Might need to switch to a different brand from here on.
customer_reviews.author: Thang Kim Le

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Lots of outputs and has a power input. Twin fans so if one goes bad, your card won't fry instantly. Ran furmark burn-in test on it for four hours and it leveled off at 60C and 60% fan power, so lots of margin for hot cases or dust buildup.
customer_reviews.author: L. Shuler

customer_reviews.title: I'm so happy with my new graphics card
customer_reviews.text: This graphics card is a great deal for the money the 750ti's run good and cool and for 120$ this made my cheap little athlon x2 220 run ok I will be upgrading to a 860k but my point is that this card can make just about any PC a gaming computer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome card for price
customer_reviews.text: If you're not knee deep in need for high memory graphics for games but just need a solid and versatile card for a pretty amazing price this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Clouse

customer_reviews.title: Good card, but make sure your case has good ...
customer_reviews.text: Good card, but make sure your case has good exhaust because this blower style will fill your case with heat.
customer_reviews.author: TAE

customer_reviews.title: This is a great video card.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced 2 GTX650s with this one card and it works like a champ! All of the games work fine and I use less power...until I get another one of these, that is.
customer_reviews.author: BigDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This brand in video card it`s Ok, recomended this video card, quality vs price is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Polo

customer_reviews.title: Not a new model but quite a strong performer
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really a gamer but I have a fairly powerful rig. My obsolete graphics card was in use only because it had 2 DVI ports for 2 monitors. This card eliminated what was a weak point and the overall performance has benefitted.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyrInJeff

customer_reviews.title: Great card..rebate process is  utterly ridiculous and painful
customer_reviews.text: Great card...great performance for the price. I have a budget HP Pavilion so I had upgrade my Power supply to 500W.for the the PCIE 6+2 Pin. I gave the card 5 stars, however Rebate process is utterly ridiculous and painful. Gave up on applying for rebate which apparently what ASUS wants you to do! Don't buy the card for the rebate price! Buy it for the listed price for a great performing card. The Asus overclocking software is impressive and I found it easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saticfied customer
customer_reviews.text: My computer was a bit "outdated" for this particular graphics card. So I had to do some more upgrading but its working and im saticfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Games look great. Just make sure your case is vented well ...
customer_reviews.text: It was time for a new card and at this price? I could not pass it up. I bought this card because of the 4 monitor display and so far, all is working well. No negatives to report as of yet. Games look great. Just make sure your case is vented well and you should be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works much better (faster) than the onboard video and it was small enough to fit my Dell Optiplex 745
customer_reviews.author: Logic

customer_reviews.title: Great starter card for beginning pc gaming
customer_reviews.text: Great starter card for beginning pc gaming. Will execute most games acceptably in 1080p. I got this because of the cooling properties and the silenced fans under light load. Does not disappoint in these regards. Excellent card
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: Found screens for office environment. Plug in and go.
customer_reviews.text: Straight up plug and play four monitors. No crazy adapters or anything. Can't beat that.
customer_reviews.author: Roland James

customer_reviews.title: Overclocking beast. Best budget card
customer_reviews.text: I want expecting much from this card, but after overclocking I was absolutely amazed. On a manual overclock of boost 1584Mhz and a memory clock of 5600 I gained 10-20+ additional frames. Now, don't expect to run AAA games on ultra, but you can run them with 30+ fps on low. When it comes to other games like cs go, warframe, dota2, anything like that, you can easily max out the graphics and be well above 60 frames.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D'Augustine

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for the money conscious gamer.
customer_reviews.text: So far it has handled anything I have thrown at it (Skyrim, Fallout, DayZ mod). all on ultra settings. It runs quiet and was a wonderful upgrade for the 11 year old paperweight that it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: REQUIRES PCI-E 6 PIN MALE TO 6 MALE POWER CABLE
customer_reviews.text: Great card! Surprisingly quiet. I did not realize that I needed a power cable to connect the card to the power supply. Be sure to have a PCI-e 6 pin male to 6 pin male or 6 pin male to 2xMolex cable on hand before installing. I had to go to eBay to purchase the former cable, but it's working great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: ASUS GeForce GTX 750Ti GDDR5 2GB Graphics Card GTX750TI-OC-2GD5
product_meta.description: The GTX750TI-OC-2GD5 is equipped with twin optimized fans carefully selected by engineers drive 2Xgreater airflow while maintaining 3Xquieter performance, combining enhanced cooling with a more pleasant gaming and computing environment. It's exclusively-formulated alloy components boost performance by reducing power loss, enhancing durability, and achieving cooler operation. Choke concrete cores eliminate buzzing sound under full load while capacitors assure a 50,000-hour lifespan: equivalent to 2.5 times longer than traditional capacitors. The NVIDIA GPU Boost 2.0 technology is for intelligent monitoring of clock speed, ensuring that the GPU runs at its peak and the game is at its highest frame rate possible. It offers new levels of customization, including GPU temperature target, overclocking, and unlocked voltage.
feature_bullets: Dual fans increase thermal efficiency with 2x greater airflow and 3x lower noise emissions
Premium alloys in power delivery components defeat heat for cards that run 15% faster and last 2.5 times longer than reference
1150 MHz Engine Clock for better performance and outstanding gaming experience
GPU TWEAK helps you modify Clock speeds, voltages, fan performance and more, all via an intuitive interface
GPU TWEAK streaming let you share on-screen action in real time - so others can watch live as games is played
OC edition, GPU clock higher than reference for smoother gameplay
ASUS Dual Fan Cooling thermal design provides 2X greater airflow and runs 3X quieter
Premium alloys in power delivery components dissipates heat for cards that run 15% faster and last 2.5 times longer than reference
GPU Tweak provides real-time and intuitive tweaking.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars850 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
